reporting_cycle: at least once every three months
summary:
The Security Council:
- Requests the Secretary-General to share the HNP reform plan with the Council, including size, standards, timetable, and resources (para 5).
- Directs MINUSTAH to focus resources on security and protection during the electoral period, including reviewing civilian police rules of engagement (para 6).
- Urges MINUSTAH and Haitian authorities to coordinate HNP and MINUSTAH civilian police efforts (para 7).
- Reaffirms MINUSTAH's authority to vet and certify HNP personnel, and urges the Transitional Government to ensure HNP personnel are certified (para 8).
- Calls for MINUSTAH to operationalize the Joint Mission Analysis Cell and use aviation assets efficiently (para 9).
- Urges the Transitional Government to investigate human rights violations, particularly those involving HNP officers, and for MINUSTAH to support this effort (para 10).
- Welcomes the national dialogue and stresses its importance for national reconciliation and credible elections (para 11).
- Urges implementation of the DDR programme and calls on Member States to provide resources (para 12).
- Renews appeal for disbursement of pledged funds and supports the follow-up donor conference (para 13).
- Requests MINUSTAH to strengthen quick-impact projects and coordination with development actors (para 14).
- Invites Bretton Woods institutions to consider debt sustainability and HIPC initiative implications (para 15).
- Urges MINUSTAH to develop a proactive communications strategy (para 16).
- Welcomes efforts to implement the zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse (para 17).
- Requests the Secretary-General to report on MINUSTAH's mandate implementation every three months (para 18).
- Decides to remain seized of the matter (para 19).
